Attributes.description: Review of probability theory, signals and noise; digital communication over Gaussian noise channels, optimal receiver design, modulation techniques and error performance calculations; measure of information, source coding, symbol and stream codes; channel coding, capacity, simple linear block codes; practical applications.
Attributes.prereq: Pre-reqs: ELEC 221 and one of ELEC 321, MATH 302, MATH 318, STAT 251, STAT 302, STAT 357.
